name: Cancer Data
title: Cancer Data

api_list.name: /urinarySy
api_list.description: The 'urinarySy' endpoint is part of the CancerData API, which provides information on cancer-related data. This specific endpoint allows users to retrieve a list of possible values for the 'urinarySy' field. The 'urinarySy' field refers to urinary symptoms experienced by individuals. These symptoms may include frequent urination, pain or discomfort during urination, blood in the urine, or urgency to urinate. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive array of strings representing various urinary symptoms associated with cancer. These values can aid in the analysis and understanding of the prevalence and patterns of urinary symptoms in cancer patients.It is important to note that the endpoint does not provide specific examples but rather presents a collection of potential values for the 'urinarySy' field. Researchers, healthcare professionals, or data analysts can use this endpoint to explore and leverage the available data to gain insights into the urinary symptoms experienced by individuals affected by cancer.

api_list.name: /colorectal
api_list.description: The 'colorectal' endpoint in the CancerData API provides a collection of strings representing values related to colorectal cancer. Colorectal cancer is a type of cancer that affects the colon or rectum. This endpoint offers a range of possible values related to colorectal cancer, such as different stages, genetic markers, treatment options, risk factors, or diagnostic tests. These strings may include medical terminology, abbreviations, or specific identifiers that healthcare professionals or researchers use to categorize or study colorectal cancer. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive list of relevant information pertaining to colorectal cancer, contributing to research, analysis, or awareness efforts in this field.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the CancerData API, providing users with valuable information related to their query. When you make a request to endpoint, you will receive array of objects that represent of data specifically associated with the you provided.These records as a comprehensive collection of cancer information, allowing users to gain insights and analyze the data they seek in a user-friendly manner Whether you are a researcher medical professional, or just someone interested in cancer data, this endpoint empowers you to explore and uncover meaningful patterns or trends.By utilizing the 'records' endpoint, you can access a wealth of valuable information that spans various aspects such as patient demographics, treatment approaches, cancer types, and more. This will assist you in making informed decisions, conducting research, or simply enhancing your understanding of cancer-related data.The 'records' endpoint forms the backbone of the CancerData API, serving as a gateway to vast amounts of valuable information waiting to be explored and utilized to make a positive impact in the field of cancer research and healthcare.

api_list.name: /lungBronc
api_list.description: The 'lungBronc' endpoint in the CancerData API provides a list different values associated with the field 'lungBronc'. This field is related to information about lung bronchoscopy procedures. When accessing this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings containing various values. These values could represent specific types of lung bronchoscopies, unique identifiers, or any other relevant information related to lung bronchoscopy procedures.By using the 'lungBronc' endpoint, you can retrieve a comprehensive list of all the possible values associated with lung bronchoscopy, which may help in analyzing and understanding the diverse aspects of this medical procedure. These values enable researchers, medical professionals, or analysts to explore and categorize the different manifestations or characteristics of lung bronchoscopies.It is important to note that the given examples (197.644082536, 258.182965662, 188.617352796) are not actual values but are provided as placeholders. The actual values returned by the endpoint will depend on the dataset used by the CancerData API.

api_list.name: /prostateC
api_list.description: TheprostateC' endpoint from the CancerData API provides a range of values related to prostate cancer. These values are represented as an array of strings. This endpoint helps in understanding the various possible measurements, characteristics, or statistics associated with prostate cancer.By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain valuable information about different aspects of prostate cancer. This could include factors such as tumor size, growth rate, biochemical markers, or other relevant data points. The array of strings represents a comprehensive set of values that medical professionals or researchers might find useful for analysis, studies, or tracking trends in prostate cancer cases.The 'prostateC' endpoint showcases the diverse nature of prostate cancer and allows users to explore a wide range of numerical values associated with this disease. This information can contribute to a better understanding of prostate cancer and potentially aid in the development of new treatments, diagnostic techniques, or preventive strategies.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the CancerData API provides a list of options for the field 'dataListIndex'. This field contains various values associated with cancer data. When you make a request to this endpoint, it will return an array of strings, which are the possible values you can use for the 'dataListIndex' field. These values help you to retrieve specific subsets of cancer data that match a particular criteria or category.For instance, if you want to access cancer data related to different types of tumors, you can use the values returned by this endpoint to filter your request accordingly. You can choose from a range of options, such as 14, 11, 18, and many others. These values represent distinct categories or identifiers within the cancer data system.By using the 'dataListIndex' endpoint, you can gain insights and retrieve specific datasets that align with your research or analysis needs by selecting the appropriate value from the list provided.

api_list.name: /breastCan
api_list.description: The 'breastCan' endpoint from the 'CancerData' API provides a collection of specific values related to breast cancer. These values represent different aspects or features associated with breast cancer. Instead of returning numeric data or lengthy descriptions, the endpoint returns an array of strings that encapsulate these diverse characteristics.By utilizing this endpoint, users can easily access an extensive range of potential values for the 'breastCan' field. The endpoint acts as a valuable resource for researchers, medical professionals, and healthcare analysts who require comprehensive information on breast cancer. It allows them to explore various perspectives, conditions, or statistical data related to this prevalent disease.The 'breastCan' endpoint facilitates efficient analysis, empowering users to gain insights, draw correlations, or uncover patterns within the data. Its user-friendly interface enables convenient navigation and retrieval of relevant strings pertaining to breast cancer. Researchers can leverage this endpoint to conduct studies, develop strategies, or promote awareness about breast cancer based on the compiled information.

api_list.name: /allCancer
api_list.description: The 'allCancer' endpoint from the CancerData API provides a user-friendly array of strings containing various possible values for the 'allCancer' field. This field represents different measurements or indicators related to cancer. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve valuable information on cancer data, such as statistics, rates, or scores from various sources. The array of strings may include terms like 'cancer incidence rate,' 'tumor aggressiveness score,' 'cancer mortality rate,' and many more. These values help users gain a comprehensive understanding of cancer-related data and can be utilized for research, analysis, or comparison purposes. The API presents an extensive range of 'allCancer' values, facilitating exploration and access to diverse aspects of cancer-related information.

api_list.name: /shapeLength
api_list.description: The endpoint 'shapeLength' in the CancerData API provides a collection of values pertaining to the length of shapes associated with cancer-related data. These values are presented as an array of strings. The 'shapeLength' field represents the measurement of the geometric length of various shapes, which are likely to be related to cancer analysis.By utilizing this endpoint, users can access a comprehensive set of possible 'shapeLength' values. These values are crucial in understanding the physical characteristics of cancer-related shapes, such as tumors or affected areas in the body. Researchers and analysts can benefit from this information to study the sizes and dimensions of cancer-related structures, aiding in the development of effective diagnosis techniques and treatment strategies.Example values for this endpoint include numerical strings like 180171.962435806, 207743.912573801, and 209118.936757727. However, these examples are not exhaustive and there are numerous other values encompassed within the 'shapeLength' endpoint.

api_list.name: /shapeArea
api_list.description: The 'shapeArea' endpoint in the CancerData API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of possible values for the field 'shapeArea'. The values returned by this endpoint are represented as an array of strings. ShapeArea refers to the measurement of the area occupied by a particular shape or object. In the context of the CancerData API, this field might pertain to the area of a tumor or a specific region of interest related to cancer research.By utilizing this endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive range of shapeArea values that could be relevant to their data analysis or application needs. These values could potentially help in categorizing different shapes or objects based on their respective areas. However, it is important to note that the specific values provided in the examples (617591322.949219, 730424359.514813, 519658694.929367) are not representative of the full set of results that can be obtained from the endpoint.

api_list.name: /zip
api_list.description: The 'zip' endpoint in the CancerData API provides a collection of available zip codes. Zip codes are unique numerical codes assigned to specific geographical areas in order to facilitate efficient mail delivery. This endpoint returns an array of strings that contains all the possible zip code values. It enables users to retrieve a comprehensive list of zip codes stored in the CancerData database. Each string in the array represents a different zip code, allowing users to access information related to specific areas of interest. By leveraging this endpoint, developers can incorporate accurate zip code data into various applications or analyze patterns and statistics based on different geographical regions.

api_list.name: /fid
api_list.description: Thefid' endpoint in the CancerData API provides information about the possible values for the 'fid' field. This field represents a unique identifier associated with different elements within the cancer dataset. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings containing all the possible 'fid' values.These 'fid' values act as a reference or code for specific elements related to cancer data. Each 'fid' represents a distinct entity or piece of information within the dataset. For example, an 'fid' could refer to a particular medical test, a patient's demographic information, or a specific aspect of cancer research.By accessing the 'fid' endpoint, you can retrieve an overview of the various 'fid' values available in the CancerData API. This can be useful for understanding the types of data elements present in the dataset, enabling you to perform more targeted queries or analysis based on specific 'fid' values of interest.
